alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CAMDEN AND NORTHEASTERN CURRITUCK COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shiloh, or 8 miles east of Camden, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Corolla around 410 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Barco, Coinjock, Riddle, Poplar Branch, Aydlett, Waterlily, Bertha, Goose Creek, and Bartlett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina.
